column1: What's that? You think we look alike?
Hah! I was just mimicking you!
They call me the Copycat girl! I come here every night because I love to dance!
column2: Me llaman la chica imitadora ¡Vengo aquí todas las noches porque me encanta bailar!

column1: You should come dance with me!
What's that? You want me to come with you?
Not now! We're dancing! We'll leave after we're done!
Now go on the other side of the stage and try to copy my dance moves!
column2: Ahora ve al otro lado del escenario e intenta copiar mis movimientos de baile

column1: Woah! I'm dizzy! Here, take this!
The music is so loud! I can't hear anything you're saying!
column2: ¡La música está tan alta! ¡No puedo oír nada de lo que dices!

column1: Do you like to dance too?
Yay! Well then I challenge you to a dance battle!
column2: ¡Genial! ¡Entonces te desafío a una batalla de baile!

column1: Go on the other side of the stage and try to copy my dance moves!
column2: Ve al otro lado del escenario e intenta copiar mis movimientos de baile

column1: Ohh... Why are you in a dance club?
column2: Ohh... ¿Por qué estás en un club de baile?

column1: You want to dance with me? Yay!
I think I lost my Gold Ring in the toilets upstairs.
column2: Creo que perdí mi anillo de oro en los baños de arriba.

column1: Think you could go have a look for me please?
column2: ¿Crees que podrías buscarlo por mí, por favor?

column1: Oh! This looks like my Gold Ring. Did you go get it for me?
column2: ¡Oh! Este parece mi anillo de oro. ¿Lo fuiste a buscar por mí?

column1: Thanks for getting my gold ring back. Have a good night!
column2: Gracias por devolverme el anillo de oro. ¡Que tengas una buena noche!

column1: Aren't you a little young to be in a place like this?
column2: ¿No eres un poco joven para estar en un lugar como este?

column1: Bartending is hard work. But at least now Team Rocket is off our backs!
column2: Ser bartender es un trabajo duro. Pero al menos ahora el Team Rocket nos deja en paz

column1: Hey! I'm the Copycat girl! Do you want to dance with me?
column2: ¡Hola! Soy la chica imitadora ¿Quieres bailar conmigo?

column1: Wait... You're completely sober! That won't do!
column2: Espera... ¡Estás completamente sobrio! Eso no sirve

column1: Go get something to drink and then we'll dance!
column2: Ve a tomar algo y luego bailamos

column1: Set copycat girl appearance to player's
column2: Set copycat girl appearance to player's

column1: Not quite! You still need to get some practice!
Wow, you're good! Almost as good as me!
column2: ¡Guau, eres bueno! ¡Casi tan bueno como yo!

column1: Here, have a drink on me. You deserve it!
column2: Aquí, toma una bebida por mi cuenta. ¡Te la mereces!

column1: \b\pn downed the glass in one gulp!
column2: \b\pn bebió el vaso de un trago

column1: Hmm... Not exactly! You still need to get some practice!
Since you're so good at mimicking dance moves, I want you to hold on to this Pokémon.
column2: Como eres tan bueno imitando movimientos de baile, quiero que cuides este Pokémon

column1: Smeargle is an expert at mimicking! He can mimic more than just dance moves too!
column2: Smeargle es un experto en imitar ¡Puede imitar más que solo movimientos de baile!

column1: Yawn.. I had a lot of fun, but I'm all worn-out now. I gotta head back home and get a good sleep!
column2: Bostezo... Me divertí mucho, pero ya estoy agotada. Tengo que ir a casa y dormir bien
Soy el padre de la chica imitadora

column1: My daughter is never home! She's always out partying somewhere. It's really becoming a problem.
column2: Mi hija nunca está en casa ¡Siempre está de fiesta en algún lugar! Esto se está volviendo un problema

column1: I always try to tell her to come home, but of course she won't listen to me.
column2: Siempre trato de decirle que regrese a casa, pero por supuesto que no me escucha

column1: Hey, you seem fairly young yourself. Maybe you could convince her to come back home! What do you say?
column2: Oye, tú pareces bastante joven. Quizás podrías convencerla de que vuelva a casa ¿Qué dices?

column1: -- Always use events 20, 21 or 22 for bubble position --
column2: -- Always use events 20, 21 or 22 for bubble position --

column1: \C[1]Find the Copycat Girl and get her to come to this hotel!
column2: \C[1]Encuentra a la chica imitadora y haz que venga a este hotel

column1: My daughter is always out partying somewhere. Please get her to come back here in this hotel!
column2: Mi hija siempre está de fiesta en algún lugar. Por favor haz que vuelva a este hotel

column1: I cannot believe it! You actually convinced her to come back to her family!
column2: No puedo creerlo ¡Realmente la convenciste de que vuelva con su familia!

column1: I told her to go back home as soon as she got here.
column2: Le dije que regresara en cuanto llegó

column1: I don't know how you did it, but here's a Pokémon as a token of my appreciation!
column2: No sé cómo lo hiciste, pero aquí tienes un Pokémon como muestra de agradecimiento

column1: poke =PokeBattle_Pokemon.new(:DITTO,25,$Trainer) move=getConst(PBMoves,:SKETCH) poke.moves[0]=PBMove.new(move) poke.moves[1]=PBMove.new(move) #plus 2 autres fois pbAddPokemon(poke)
column2: poke =PokeBattle_Pokemon.new(:DITTO,25,$Trainer) move=getConst(PBMoves,:SKETCH) poke.moves[0]=PBMove.new(move) poke.moves[1]=PBMove.new(move) #plus 2 autres fois pbAddPokemon(poke)

column1: This Smeargle has been in our family since I was a child. Please take care of it.
column2: Este Smeargle ha estado en nuestra familia por mucho tiempo Por favor cuídalo

column1: This Smeargle has been in our family for a long time. Please take care of it!
column2: Este Smeargle ha estado en nuestra familia por mucho tiempo Por favor cuídalo
¡No puedo parar, no voy a parar!

column1: Ready? Try to copy my dance moves!
